last_episode_to_air.name: Animals are People Too
last_episode_to_air.overview: Graeme's pet shop has a special new line - people dressed up as animals, but they also suffer from being dumped so Tim sets up a protection society, while Graeme cruelly puts the strays to work.

name: The Goodies
overview: A British television comedy series of the 1970s and early 1980s, combining surreal sketches and situation comedy.

episodes.name: Beefeaters
episodes.overview: The Goodies are asked to assist in discovering who is stealing the Beefeaters' beef.

episodes.name: Snooze
episodes.overview: The Goodies are asked to market a bedtime drink called 'Venom'. They decide that the first thing needed is a name change to 'Snooze'.

episodes.name: Give Police a Chance
episodes.overview: The Goodies are hired to improve the image of the police with the general public.

episodes.name: Playgirl Club
episodes.overview: The Goodies are asked to recover some sexually explicit photographs of politicians.

episodes.name: The Greenies
episodes.overview: The Goodies go on holiday to a Cornish village that has been subjected to military takeover.

episodes.name: Cecily
episodes.overview: The Goodies take a job helping out at a stately home, and meet sweet Cecily, who is not all that she seems...

episodes.name: Radio Goodies
episodes.overview: The Goodies open a pirate radio station - and post office.

episodes.name: The Loch Ness Monster
episodes.overview: The Goodies help a suicidal zookeeper to locate a monster for London Zoo's Snowdon Monster House.

guest_stars.character: Zookeeper in Charge of the Monster House
guest_stars.name: Bernard Bresslaw

episodes.name: Commonwealth Games
episodes.overview: The Goodies take part in the Commonwealth Games as the British team against the August Bank Holiday Islands - with the entire Commonwealth at stake.

episodes.name: Pollution
episodes.overview: The land is covered in pollution and the Goodies suspect corruption.

episodes.name: The Lost Tribe
episodes.overview: The Goodies are asked to find Professor Knutts who went missing whilst leading an expedition to find the Lost Tribe of the Orinoco in 1951. They eventually find him - in Sevenoaks.

episodes.name: Music Lovers
episodes.overview: Musicians are being kidnapped all over the country, so The Goodies become famous musicians too, eventually get stolen and come face-to-face with their arch-enemy - The Music Master.

episodes.name: For Art's Sake
episodes.overview: Tim's crusade to stop rich Americans from buying all of Britain's art treasures sees him bidding a huge amount of money for one painting, forcing the Goodies to take drastic action to pay for it.

episodes.name: Kitten Kong
episodes.overview: The Goodies' Animal Clinic looks after various problem animals, including Twinkle the kitten who, thanks to Graeme's growth formula, grows to a massive size and terrorises London.

episodes.name: Dancing
episodes.overview: Asked to be part of a formation dancing team, the Goodies find that dancing isn't as gentle and pure as they thought, especially when they encounter Delia Capone and her corrupt team.

episodes.name: Farm Fresh Food
episodes.overview: Disgusted at the awful cuisine served up at Ye Olde Shepherds Restaurant, the Goodies head to the farm of Tim's uncle for some fresh country food, only to be further disappointed upon arrival.

episodes.name: Free to Live
episodes.overview: Bill reports Graeme and Tim to the Women's Liberation Front after he disapproves of their treatment of Graeme's new totty. As a punishment, they are sent to work for Lord Charles (a male chauvinist) - Graeme as the butler and Tim as the maid.

episodes.name: Gender Education
episodes.overview: In response to a proposed appalling BBC film (for schoolchildren, mark you) on S-E-X education, Mrs. Desiree Carthorse - the self-proclaimed most powerful person in the field of television, if not the world, enlists The Goodies to make her version: 'How to Make Babies by Doing Dirty Things'.

episodes.name: London to Brighton
episodes.overview: The Goodies are bouncing on space hoppers from London to Brighton for charity. However, they continue to bounce on around the world much to the horror of their tight-fisted sponsor.

episodes.name: Double Trouble
episodes.overview: The Goodies' bid to win the Nice Person of the Year Award is being sabotaged by the mysterious Dr. Petal and his evil robot doubles of them and other famous people.

episodes.name: Kitten Kong (Montreux edition)
episodes.overview: The Goodies' Animal Clinic looks after various problem animals, including Twinkle the kitten who, thanks to Graeme's growth formula, grows to a massive size and terrorises London.

episodes.name: Come Dancing
episodes.overview:
Come Dancing is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Wicked Waltzing".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Farm Fresh Food
episodes.overview:
Farm Fresh Food is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Health Farm" and "Uncle Tom's Farm".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Women's Lib
episodes.overview:
Women's Lib is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Sexual Liberation" and as "Free to Live".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Gender Education
episodes.overview:
Gender Education is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Sex and Violence".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Charity Bounce
episodes.overview:
Charity Bounce is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "London to Brighton".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: The Baddies
episodes.overview:
"The Baddies" is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "The Nicest Person in the World" and "Double Trouble" and as "Bad Copies".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: The New Office
episodes.overview: The Goodies need a new office, but after being ripped off in the local estate agent they decide to build their own - a Graeme designed mobile disused railway station.

episodes.name: Hunting Pink
episodes.overview: Tim is off to spend the weekend at Tally-Ho Towers with his rich Great Uncle Butcher-Fitzsimmons. He is dressed as a Guardsman in the hope that this will impress the old man into leaving him all his money in his will. Bill and Graeme think this is despicable, disgusting - and a very good idea, so they invite themselves along.

episodes.name: The Winter Olympics
episodes.overview: The Goodies agree to be Britain's team in the Winter Olympics at the North Pole (there's apparently been a lot of snow there recently).

episodes.name: That Old Black Magic
episodes.overview: Witch Hazel's problems with casting spells leads the Goodies to help her to contact lost souls via a seance, and Graeme's mystical powers eventually see him turned into a gibbon.

episodes.name: For Those in Peril on the Sea
episodes.overview: Graeme's urge to recreate an early Viking expedition and find the Lost Island Of Munga sees the Goodies shipwrecked and at the mercy of an old foe from a previous show.

episodes.name: Way Outward Bound
episodes.overview: The failure to find any kids willing to go to an adventure school forces the Goodies to attend disguised as children, only to find that the school is being used for a far more sinister cause.

episodes.name: Superstar
episodes.overview: Appalled at the offensive songs in the hit parade, the Goodies perform a sickly sweet song on the Maxie Grease Show, but Bill is exploited and turned into a superstar by an unscrupulous agent.

episodes.name: The New Office
episodes.overview:
The New Office is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Monster Machines" and as "Moving Day".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Hunting Pink
episodes.overview:
Hunting Pink is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Where There's a Will" and "A Hunting We Will Go" and as "Tally-Ho".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Winter Olympics
episodes.overview:
Winter Olympics is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.overview:

This episode is also known as "Black Magic" and "Which Witch is Which?".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: For Those in Peril on the Sea
episodes.overview:
For Those in Peril on the Sea is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "The Lost Island of Munga" and as "A High-Sea Adventure".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Way Outward Bound
episodes.overview:
Way Outward Bound is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Outward Bounds" and "Baby Army".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Superstar
episodes.overview:
Superstar is a special episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Rock Star".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Camelot
episodes.overview: Tim's Uncle King Arthur (actually Arthur King, but appearing as 'King, Arthur' in the phone book) is away on holiday and the Goodies have to look after his home, firstly turning it into a tourist attraction, then having to defend it from the clutches of the local town planner.

episodes.name: Invasion of the Moon Creatures
episodes.overview: Graeme's attempt to send rabbits to the moon seems to be a failure until Bill and Tim's space voyage discovers plots of vegetables and the menacing presence of Big Bunny.

episodes.name: Hospital for Hire
episodes.overview: A bad experience with the hospital system forces the Goodies to become doctors themselves and attempt to fix up the health system with the help of Graeme's magic elixir.

episodes.name: The Goodies and the Beanstalk
episodes.overview: The Goodies have hit rock-bottom and are forced to sell Buttercup for a tin of baked beans. In an act of desperation, Graeme plants one of the beans...

episodes.name: The Stone Age
episodes.overview: Graeme discovers an ancient tunnel below the Goodies' office and his penchant for potholing soon finds them stuck inside the stomach of a tyrannosaurus rex.

episodes.name: Goodies in the Nick
episodes.overview: A timid policeman needs the Goodies' help in boosting his tally of arrests, but their fiendishly cunning bank robbery sees them locked away in prison and desperate to escape.

episodes.name: The Race
episodes.overview: A wrong turn to Skegness sees the Goodies winning the Tour de France cycling race, so they decide to also enter Le Mans and convert their disused railway station office into a car.

episodes.name: Camelot
episodes.overview:
Camelot is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Invasion of the Moon Creatures
episodes.overview:
Invasion of the Moon Creatures is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Big Bunny" and "On the Moon with Big Bunny".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Hospital for Hire
episodes.overview:
Hospital for Hire is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "The National Health Service" and "Doctors".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: The Goodies and the Beanstalk
episodes.overview:
"The Goodies and the Beanstalk" is a special episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: The Stone Age
episodes.overview:
The Stone Age is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies

This episode is also known as "Archaeologists" and "Dinosaur" and as "Tyrannosaurus Rex" and also as "Pot-Holing" and "Let's Go Pot-Holing".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Goodies in the Nick
episodes.overview:
Goodies in the Nick is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "The Great Goodies Bank Robbery" and "Bank Robbery".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: The Race
episodes.overview:
The Race is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: The Movies
episodes.overview: The Goodies buy a movie studio and attempt to revitalise the British film industry, but ultimately descend into chaos when they each try to shoot their own film at the same time.

episodes.name: The Clown Virus
episodes.overview: A job to dispose of a harmless can of 'tomato soup' for an American military base sees the whole British population turned into clowns and ripe for an invasion by US troops.

episodes.name: Chubby Chumps
episodes.overview: Tim has become rather flabby while the others have been away fishing, but trims himself down thanks to a brainwashing radio DJ and enters the Miss Housewife of the Year Contest.

episodes.name: Wacky Wales
episodes.overview: An invitation to an eisteddfod in Wales has the Goodies in all sorts of trouble with the Reverend after they dare to break many of the puritanical local laws and actually try to entertain people.

episodes.name: Frankenfido
episodes.overview: Graeme's dog breeding venture gets out of hand and Tim's only chance to win at Crufts is to dress Bill in a dog costume, which forces Graeme to create a shaggy monster of his own.

episodes.name: Scatty Safari
episodes.overview: The main attraction at The Goodies Star Safari Park, Tony Blackburn, is hearing the call of the wild and pining for his freedom. The trio realise that they can no longer keep such a magnificent beast in captivity, and release him. But who should they get to replace him?

episodes.name: Kung Fu Kapers!
episodes.overview: Bill reveals himself to be a Grand Master of the infinitely more subtle and superior Lancastrian martial art of Ecky Thump.

episodes.name: Lighthouse Keeping Loonies
episodes.overview: The Goodies answer an advert for 'a little light housekeeping' and find themselves stuck for five years in charge of an 'overgrown lamp post'.

episodes.name: Rome Antics
episodes.overview: In 55AD the early Goodies venture to Rome to provide entertainment for the fruit-fancying Emperor, but are eventually confronted by Attila the Hun and the invading Barbarians.

episodes.name: Cunning Stunts
episodes.overview: Bill is fired from the Goodies' newspaper for being a hopeless reporter and after he is rejected by the love of his life, he decides to end it all by entering the Eurovision Raving Loony Contest.

episodes.name: South Africa
episodes.overview: The Goodies are forced to emigrate to South Africa where the absence of black people forces a new form of segregation called apart-height, mainly affecting short people like jockeys and Bill.

episodes.name: Bunfight at the OK Tearooms
episodes.overview: With hardly a penny to their name, the Goodies go prospecting for gold - and discover Cornish cream.

episodes.name: The End
episodes.overview: The Goodies’ office accidentally gets covered in concrete, leaving them trapped for a century. They desperately try to survive while they grow hungry and slightly mad…

episodes.name: Goodies Rule - OK?
episodes.overview: The unwanted Goodies finally hit the big time after years of failure, only for the government to topple and all forms of fun to be banned, requiring a civil uprising and a puppet government.

episodes.name: The Movies
episodes.overview:
The Movies is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "The British Film Industry" and "The Black & White, Western, Epic Movie'" as well as "BBC" and "The Choices of Film Creation".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.overview:

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: The Goodies Rule – O.K.?

The costume designer for this episode was BBC costume designer Dee Robson.

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Lips, or Almighty Cod
episodes.overview: Cod have become so scarce that there is nothing to make fish fingers from.

episodes.name: Hype Pressure
episodes.overview: Tim invites Bill and Graeme to perform on the talent show he presents.

episodes.name: Daylight Robbery on the Orient Express
episodes.overview: Goodies Holidays is creating an exciting mystery tour aboard the Orient Express for the Detectives Club, but things go astray when the train is hijacked and taken to the Le Boring Contest.

episodes.name: Black and White Beauty
episodes.overview: Graeme has established a rest home for clapped-out old animals and is sent a pantomime horse, which Tim trains before it is callously stolen by Bill to enter in the Grand National.

episodes.name: It Might as Well be String
episodes.overview: A series of too honest ads sees revenue for the Goodies' advertising agency plummet, until Tim discovers the joys of string, and Bill and Graeme set about ripping him off.

episodes.name: 2001 and a Bit
episodes.overview: The futuristic sons of the Goodies have become bored with the extremely violent forms of modern entertainment and seek to revive something truly civilised from their fathers' era - cricket.

episodes.name: The Goodies - Almost Live
episodes.overview: A concert featuring many of The Goodies' best known songs, including Cactus in my Y-Fronts, Funky Gibbon, Black Pudding Bertha, Bounce, Last Chance Dance and Wild Thing.

episodes.name: Lips, or Almighty Cod
episodes.overview:
Lips, or Almighty Cod is an episode of the award-winng British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Cod".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Hype Pressure
episodes.overview:
"Hype Pressure" is an episode of the award-winng British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "The Rock and Roll Revival".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: It Might as Well Be String
episodes.overview:

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: 2001 & A Bit
episodes.overview:
2001 & A Bit is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as The Future of the Goodies, with the Goodies playing both their elderly selves, and versions of each other.

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: The Goodies – Almost Live
episodes.overview:
The Goodies – Almost Live is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies. It was the final episode of the sixth season and rather than a traditional sitcom episode was a pop concert in which they performed some of their songs, including the hit single Funky Gibbon. This episode is also known as "The Goodies in Concert".

The Goodies also appear as "Pan's Grannies", which are obviously based on the dance group Pan's People.

episodes.name: Alternative Roots
episodes.overview: A historical look back at the ancestors of the Goodies; Celtic Kilty (Graeme), County Cutie (Tim) and Kinda Kinky (Bill) and how they were captured by the evil television slave traders.

episodes.name: Dodonuts
episodes.overview: Disgusted by Tim and Graeme's love of hunting, Bill vows to protect the last dodo.

episodes.name: Scoutrageous
episodes.overview: Tim indoctrinates Bill and Graeme into the Scouts, but they take things to extremes resulting in the movement being declared illegal.

episodes.name: Punky Business
episodes.overview: The punk phenomenon grips Britain as even grannies reject niceness.

episodes.name: Royal Command
episodes.overview: The revised Royal Variety Show hosted by Graeme is so well received by the royal family that they enter showbiz but end up in hospital, requiring the Goodies to act as their replacements.

episodes.name: Earthanasia
episodes.overview: It's Christmas Eve, and as The Goodies prepare for Christmas they learn that the world is about to end.

episodes.name: Alternative Roots
episodes.overview:
Alternative Roots is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "The Goodies Find Their Roots" and "Hoots, Toots and Froots".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Scoutrageous
episodes.overview:
Scoutrageous is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Scouting Adventures" and "Boy Scouts".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Punky Business
episodes.overview:
Punky Business is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Punkerella" and as "Rock Goodies".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Royal Command
episodes.overview:
Royal Command is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Royal Command Performance".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Earthanasia
episodes.overview:
"Earthanasia" is the suspected finale of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "The End of the World Show" and "The End of the World".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Politics
episodes.overview: Graeme is faced with selling the image of two potential Prime Ministers to the nation; Bill as the revolutionary Che Monyou and Tim as the stunning Timita.

episodes.name: Saturday Night Grease
episodes.overview: Bill decides to open Disco Bilius and introduces a mixed dancing competition.

episodes.name: A Kick in the Arts
episodes.overview: The British Olympic team is broke. Tim joins them and competes against Graeme and Bill's Rest of the World team.

guest_stars.character: Chairman of the British Olympic Committee
guest_stars.name: Ballard Berkeley

episodes.name: U-Friend or UFO?
episodes.overview: The strange alien abductions of trombonists prompt Bill to solve the mystery.

episodes.name: Animals
episodes.overview: Tim becomes an animal rights activist, so Bill becomes a vegetable rights activist and a Watership Down parody ensues.

episodes.name: War Babies
episodes.overview: The Goodies are grown-up babies who are sent off to boarding school during the war years, and are asked by Churchill to go behind enemy lines to buy him a box of German cigars.

episodes.name: Goodies and Politics
episodes.overview:
Goodies and Politics is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Politics" and "Timita".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Saturday Night Grease
episodes.overview:
Saturday Night Grease is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Discotheque".

The episode was written by members of The Goodies. It has been released on both DVD and VHS.

episodes.name: A Kick in the Arts
episodes.overview:
A Kick in the Arts is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Summer Olympics".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: U-Friend or UFO?
episodes.overview:
"U-Friend or UFO?" is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Close Encounters".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Animals
episodes.overview:
Animals is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Animal Liberation" and "Animal Lib" and also "Watership Down".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: War Babies
episodes.overview:
War Babies is an episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

It was the last episode to be produced and transmitted by BBC Television.

This episode is also known as "World War 2".

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Snow White 2
episodes.overview: The Goodies find themselves living next door to Snow White and the seven dwarfs.

episodes.name: Robot
episodes.overview: Due to dire financial conditions, Bill is fired and replaced with a baby robot; however Tim and Graeme need help with raising it and hire a strange, bearded, Swedish nanny.

episodes.name: Football Crazy
episodes.overview: Bill the soccer hooligan is in fine form as Tim becomes Chief of Police in a bid to stamp out such boorish conduct, with football then becoming so boring that its fans flock to the ballet instead.

episodes.name: Big Foot
episodes.overview: The Goodies set off to the Canadian Rockies in search of the mythical Arthur C. Clarke, but find all sorts of other weird creatures including the legendary Bigfoot.

episodes.name: Change of Life
episodes.overview: Bill's 40th birthday makes the Goodies decide to close the business due to old age.

episodes.name: Holiday
episodes.overview: A supposedly relaxing holiday in the seaside village of Dunsquabblin turns very stressful when the Goodies are trapped inside for 17 days due to heavy rain and snow.

episodes.name: Animals are People Too
episodes.overview: Graeme's pet shop has a special new line - people dressed up as animals, but they also suffer from being dumped so Tim sets up a protection society, while Graeme cruelly puts the strays to work.

episodes.name: Snow White 2
episodes.overview:
Snow White 2 is a special episode of the award-winning British comedy television series The Goodies.

This episode is also known as "Pantomime" and "Snow White and the Seven Dwarfs".

This episode was made by LWT for ITV.

As always, the episode was written by members of The Goodies.

episodes.name: Animals Are People Too
episodes.overview:
